Dear Ms. Waidelich:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616-204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4157 Behavior Management
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written policies and
Description procedures that describe the institution’s behavior management
system. The policies and procedures shall be reviewed annually
and updated as needed. These shall be available to all residents,
their families, and referring agencies.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 4/24/23, vulnerable youth who is non-verbal and autistic began
yelling in the shower before school. Youth was demonstrating
self-injurious behaviors. Youth grabbed a staff member while
nude and began shaking the staff member. Staff member
grabbed youth's shoulders, pushed youth hard, and used
derogatory language with youth. Youth was not injured.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A is non-verbal youth. This consultant viewed Youth
A’s interactions at the facility on April 24, 2023. Youth A was
playing with dolls in the milieu area with staff. She appeared to be
in positive spirits and interacting with staff on the unit.
Staff 1/Complaint Source was interviewed face to face at the
facility on April 24, 2023. Staff 1 reported on 04/24/23, she was
working the morning shift with Staff 2 and Supervisor. She
reported Staff 2 was assigned to be Youth A’s staff and Youth A
was in the main shower before going to school. Staff 1 reported
she heard Youth A screaming in the main bathroom and she went
with Staff 2 to check on Youth A. She reported Staff 2 attempted
to verbally communicate with Youth A and Staff 1 went to grab
Youth A’s tablet so that she could help communicate with staff.
Youth A did not want her tablet and she began to hit herself. Staff
1 reported herself and Staff 1 tried to help Youth A stop harming
herself by blocking her punches. Youth A then grabbed onto Staff
2 with both her hands. Youth A attempted to pull Staff 2 to the
ground of the wet floor and Staff 2 then raised both of his arms
and put both of his hands on Youth A’s shoulders. Staff 1 then
witnessed Staff 2 hard shove Youth A while yelling, “Get the fuck
off of me.” Staff 1 told Staff 2 to leave the area immediately and go
take a walk. She stayed with Youth A and Supervisor came in to
help calm Youth A down. Blocking pads were used to help keep
Youth A from hitting her head on the wall and she calmed down
after about five minutes. Staff 1 was able to describe in detail
Youth A’s calming plan. She reported staff is trained with Handle
with Care to complete a grip release if needed and to use calming
voice to help talk with Youth A. Staff 1 reported staff is trained to
2

never push, yell, or swear at the youth at the facility. She reported
she works with Staff 2 a lot on first shift, and they alternate what
youth they are assigned to. She reported she has never seen Staff
2 push a youth or yell at a youth. She reported Staff 2 can be
easily frustrated at times and will be snappier with the youth but
never has harmed them or been inappropriate. Staff 1 reported
Staff 2 has been coached a couple of times to take a break from
situations and he has been receptive to that. Staff 1 reported no
other staff or youth had seen this situation occur and Supervisor
was working with the other youth when the incident occurred.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 25,
2023. Staff 2 reported on the morning of April 24, 2023, he was
working with Staff 1 and Supervisor. He reported Supervisor put
Youth A into the shower and then saw Supervisor go back in there
to give Youth A a towel. Staff 2 reported he heard Youth A start
screaming and showing escalation signs. He reported he grabbed
the pink pad to help keep Youth A from hitting her head against
the wall. Staff 2 reported Supervisor was at first in the room trying
to give Youth A a towel and he cannot remember when Staff 1
came into the bathroom. He reported when he was in the
bathroom, he tried to help block Youth A from harming herself and
she then grabbed onto his arm with one of her hands. Staff 2
reported Youth A was trying to pull him down and was swinging
her other arm with a closed fist at him. He reported he then used
inappropriate language towards Youth A because he was losing
traction with his shoes. He reported he was able to get released
from Youth A’s grip by pulling himself away quickly. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 then told him to go take a break from the situation.
He reported he never shoved or pushed Youth A. He reported the
facility is trained in Handle with Care and they complete a lot of
training with the staff. Staff 2 reported when it comes to these
escalated situations his mind goes blank and he does not
remember the training on how to complete a grip release. He
reported he does not even know what the grip release looks like.
Staff 2 reported he never harmed Youth A and was trying to make
the situation as safe as possible. He was knowledgeable about
Youth A’s calming plan and that is why he brought the pink pad
into the bathroom.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
25, 2023. Supervisor reported on April 24, 2023, she helped Youth
A take a shower before going to school. She reported Youth A is
learning some life skills on needing to dry herself. Supervisor
reported after Youth A’s shower she dried Youth A’s hair and back
with a towel and told Youth A to finish drying herself. Youth A did
3

not like this and started showing some minor pre-cursor escalation
signs. Supervisor let Youth A be and went to pass medications.
She then heard Youth A escalate and Staff 1 and Staff 2 run to the
bathroom to help her. Supervisor reported she came over to the
bathroom as Staff 2 was exiting and she went in to help Staff 1 de-
escalate Youth A. Supervisor reported Staff 1 explained to her the
events she witnessed of Staff 2 shoving Youth A and using
inappropriate language. She reported Youth A was checked over
and never saw any bruises or marks on her. Supervisor reported
staff are trained to use the Handle with Care model for grip
releases and to follow Youth A’s calming plan. She reported Staff
2 can get easily frustrated at times but will typically take a break
and not project that feeling onto the youth he is working with.
Supervisor reported Staff 2 is receptive to being told when he is
being short with the youth and when his co-workers suggest that
he take a break.
Youth B and Youth C were separately interviewed face to face
at the facility on April 24, 2023. Youth B and Youth C reported
they feel safe at the facility. They reported no concerns about the
staff mistreating the youth and they never put their hands on the
youth unless a restraint is needed. Youth B and Youth C reported
they like it when Staff 2 works because he takes them on outings.
Youth B reported sometimes when Youth A is acting up
behaviorally Staff 2 will say “no we are not dealing with that
today.” He reported he has never seen Staff 2 mistreat Youth A
and just encourages Youth A to not hurt herself or others.
Documents Reviewed:
- Facility incident report dated 04/24/23 completed by
Staff 1- Incident report was consistent with Staff 1’s
interview.
- Facility nursing assessment note dated 04/24/23-
Nursing was able to complete a physical assessment on
Youth A. Prior to the assessment Youth A was doing crafts
in the cafeteria with staff. Nursing was able to assess Youth
A’s neck, shoulders, upper chest and upper and lower
arms, and hands. No bruising or abrasions noted. No other
concerns noted.
- Developmental Adolescent Residential Treatment
Behavior Management Policy- Positive interventions
strategies should be used by staff to help assist the youth
develop improved problem solving, self- management, and
social skills.
4

- Developmental Adolescent Residential Treatment
Restraint Policy- Physical Management may only occur
with a youth whose behavior is significantly dangerous to
self or others. Physical Management is performed
according to the current techniques of the “Handle with
Care”, DART’s approved crisis intervention program. The
use of force and duration of restraint must be limited to that
which is necessary to ensure the optimal care, welfare,
safety, and security of all. Restraint techniques must never
be used for punishment, discipline, or retaliation. Prohibited
Behavior Management Techniques at the facility includes
corporal or physical punishment including spanking, hitting,
pinching, slapping, or hair pulling. Staff should not yell,
threaten, ridicule, or humiliate youth and those acts are
strictly prohibited.
- Developmental Adolescent Residential Treatment
Discipline Policy- Facility prohibits all cruel and severe
discipline including verbal abuse, ridicule, or humiliation.
- Handle with Care Manual- Handle with Care is the
restraint model that is trained within this facility. Within the
manual it notes several grip release techniques that are
approved for a staff to use when a youth has a firm grip and
will not listen to verbal de-escalation or redirections. Within
the manual there is no allowed method of pushing a youth
to release their grip.
- Youth A’s Calming Plan dated 11/14/22- This calming
plan notes Youth A has precursors to aggression and self-
injurious behavior that includes banging head, screaming,
and flopping down to the ground or couch. Staff are to used
strategies and coping skills with Youth A that includes
prompt deep breathing and model this for her, taking a
shower, and allowing her to put wet wash cloths on her
face.
- Human Resource (HR) file and Training Log for Staff 2-
Staff 2 received verbal coaching on 02/02/23 regarding an
allegation that Staff 2 shoved a youth. Staff 2 was found to
not be in violation of shoving a youth, however the facility
did take the opportunity to provide additional resources and
training to Staff 2. He was required to complete the Handle
with Care and Fatigue training which was documented as
completed. Staff 2 completed the required restraint
5

training, “Handle with Care” on 08/23/22 and 08/30/22. He
also completed the refresher training on 12/29/22.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance with staff following the
internal behavior management policy. It is unknown if Staff 2
pushed Youth A, but it is confirmed Staff 2 did not follow the
Handle with Care grip release. Staff 2 noted within in his interview
that the facility trains in the model but cannot remember it when it
comes to a crisis situation.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 2 used derogatory language with youth.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A is non-verbal youth. This consultant viewed Youth
A’s interactions at the facility on April 24, 2023. Youth A was
playing with dolls in the milieu area with the staff. She appeared to
be in positive spirits and interacting with staff members on the
unit.
Staff 1/Complaint Sources was interviewed face to face at the
facility on April 24, 2023. Staff 1 reported on April 24, 2023, she
was working with Staff 2 to calm Youth A down. Youth A
attempted to pull Staff 2 to the ground of the wet floor and Staff 2
then raised both of his arms and put both of his hands on Youth
A’s shoulders. Staff 1 witnessed Staff 2 give Youth A a hard shove
while yelling, “Get the fuck off of me.” Staff 1 told Staff 2 to leave
the area immediately and go take a walk. Staff 1 reported she has
never heard Staff 2 use inappropriate language around a youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 25,
2023. Staff 2 reported on April 24, 2023, Youth A was having an
escalated episode in the main bathroom. He reported when he
was in the bathroom, he tried to help block Youth A from harming
herself and she then grabbed onto him with one hand. Staff 2
reported Youth A was trying to pull him down and was swinging
6

her other hand with a closed fist at him. He reported he then used
inappropriate language towards Youth A because he was losing
traction with his shoes. When asked what his inappropriate
language was, Staff 2 reported he said, “Oh fuck, let go.” Staff 2
reported he knew that it was wrong and that you should never
swear in front of the youth as that is a policy at the facility. He
reported he was just escalated in the situation and did not want to
fall or harm Youth A.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
25, 2023. Supervisor reported she was not in the bathroom with
Youth A, Staff 1, and Staff 2 when this situation occurred. She
reported she did not hear Staff 2 use inappropriate language, but
she was also not close to the area as she was caring for the other
youth. Supervisor reported she has never heard Staff 2 or any
other staff at the facility use inappropriate youth around the youth.
Youth B and Youth C were separately interviewed face to face
at the facility on April 24, 2023. Both Youth B and Youth C
reported they have never heard Staff 2 use inappropriate
language around or towards youth at the facility.
Documents reviewed:
- Facility incident report dated 04/24/23 completed by
Staff 1- Incident report was consistent with Staff 1’s
interview.
- Developmental Adolescent Residential Treatment
Discipline Policy- Facility prohibits all cruel and severe
discipline including verbal abuse, ridicule, or humiliation.
- Human Resource (HR) file and Training Log for Staff 2-
Staff 2 received verbal coaching on 02/02/23 regarding an
allegation that Staff 2 shoved a youth. Staff 2 was found to
not be in violation of shoving a youth, however the facility
did take the opportunity to provide additional resources and
training to Staff 2. He was required to complete the Handle
with Care and Fatigue training which was documented as
completed. Staff 2 completed the required restraint
training, “Handle with Care” on 08/23/22 and 08/30/22. He
also completed the refresher training on 12/29/22.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as Staff 1 and Staff 2
confirmed Staff 2 used inappropriate language when Youth A
grabbed onto him.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR2021C0112029 dated 6/2/2021, CAP approved 06/29/22021
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
